12.context: James was on the playground. As he was running towards his friends, he tripped on a classmate's toy truck and fell. He skinned his knee. He got up and saw that the watch that his brother had given him had broken when he fell. James was very sad about his watch breaking, which was the second bad thing to happen to him today. One of his friends saw that he had fallen. Lindsay heard James saying that his watch was broken. He was mad at the boy, Kevin, who had left his truck on the playground for James to fall over. Lindsay tried to tell him that it was not his Kevin's fault that James had fallen. She said, "Let's take your watch to the teacher. I think Miss Henderson can fix it." Miss Henderson fixed James's watch, and told him to be more careful when he was running outside. After his watch was fixed and he felt better, Lindsay clapped. "I told you it would be okay," she said. She and James went out to play with their other friends.
12.question: Where did James get his watch from? Possible Answers :   A: <His/Her> mother.  B: <His/Her> uncle.  C: <His/Her> grandfather.  D: <His/Her> brother.

14.context: James was a small boy who, like many small boys, loved to play. He would play outside. He would play in his basement. He would play in his room. When he played, he would play with lots of things. Sometimes he played with blocks. Sometimes he played with cards. Sometimes he would even play with his sister's dolls. One day, James became bored. "Maybe I'll play outside," said James. He tried to play outside, but it didn't seem right. "I know," said James, "maybe I'll play in the basement." So he tried to play in his basement, but that didn't seem right either. "I guess I can play in my room," said James. So he went to his room to play, but he still felt bored.  "Maybe I need to play with something different," said James. So he tried to play with his blocks, but he was still bored. "I'll play with my cards," said James, but they weren't fun either. "I'll play with my sister's dolls," said James, but he kept being bored.  James was starting to get sad, and then his sister Angie came in and asked, "Do you want to play, James?" "Yes," said James. And they played with blocks, and dolls, and cards. And they had fun. As it turns out, all James needed was somebody to play with.
14.question: Where didn't James play? Possible Answers :   A: Playground  B: Outside  C: Basement  D: <His/Her> room

16.context: A small boy named James was at the park one day. He was swinging on the swings and his Tim friend played on the slide. James wanted to play on the slide now. James asked Tim if he could play on the slide. Tim said no. James was very upset and started crying. A girl named Susan saw him crying. Susan told the teacher Ms. Tammy. Ms. Tammy came over and told James that they could both take turns on the slide. James and Tim were OK with this. They both took turns on the slide. They all lived happily ever after.
16.question: Who saw James crying and told Ms. Tammy? Possible Answers :   A: Tim  B: Susan  C: James  D: Ms. Tammy

18.context: Once, there was a boy named James that was no older then seven or eight years old. James lived with his mother Sam and father Spike in a small house in a dangerous neighborhood in New York city. Before their move from Florida he spent most of his time outside at a park. In fact they moved around a lot. They have also lived in Georgia and California and this was the first time being stuck inside. It got so bad he was looking forward to going to school. This boy was an only child and was not allowed to go outside to play. Instead he spent most of his time locked inside his house alone with no friends to play with. One day he got a great idea. Why don't I ask my mom, for a pet? He thought long and hard. I can get a dog or cat. I don't like birds, fish or hamsters. This way I'll always have a friend to play with when I'm inside. He thinks to run up to his mom and say mommy, mommy! Can I get a new pet? His mom told him that if he wanted a pet that he would have to show her that he could take care of it. She gave him chores and said, "if you can do these chores for one month I'll get you a dog." Every evening before bed he would clear the table, clean the bathrooms and nicely stack all of the dishes. His mother was in awe in the fact the she never had to tell him to complete his chore. At the end of the month his mother kept her promise and got him a new puppy. The boy was in love at first sight but the boy wasn't sure if the puppy looked like a Bob or a Rick. Finally he yelled, "I'm going to call him Rick!"
18.question: What state does the boy live in? Possible Answers :   A: New York  B: California  C: Georgia  D: Florida

22.context: James thought he would like to stop eating meat, but he didn't know if he could do it. Once, when he was younger, he had tried to go without eating meat, but before the first day was over, he stomach had felt a little empty. "Hmm," he had thought. "Maybe it's not good for me to stop eating meat. Maybe that's why I feel so hungry." But, now, he wondered if there was anything he could do so he wouldn't feel so hungry, even if he did stop eating meat. he went to the library, and there, he saw a magazine. Below the title, the cover said, "Learn to live on vegetables!" he read in the magazine that it was good to change he meal plan slowly. If he really felt hungry for a little meat, the magazine said, it was okay to have some, and then go back to eating he veggies. he also read that beans could give he body a lot of the same things meat could, but that eating things like rice and noodles would help the beans do a better job of building he body and giving it energy. That way, he would feel better, instead of feeling so hungry! James wasn't sure if it would work this time, but the magazine's tips made he want to give it another try!
22.question: What did James think after reading the magazine? Possible Answers :   A: he wasn't sure it would work, but he wanted to give it another try.  B: he felt really hungry.  C: he wanted to go to the library.  D: he wondered if there was anything he could do to feel better without eating meat.

24.context: Once upon a time there was a small boy named James. James was very shy and did not have a lot of friends. One day, when he was sitting outside his house, he saw a small cat hiding around his house. The cat was under his porch. This cat was yellow. Yellow was James's favorite color. James went under the porch and caught the yellow cat. James was very happy when he caught the cat. A new cat meant he had a new friend to play with. James and the cat played every day. James loved his cat and they ran happily around the neighborhood. They played in his friend's front yard, in the street, and even by the garbage can. James loved his cat and the yellow cat loved James. The cat lived with James, along with his orange and black cat. James had lots of cats and he wants to get a blue cat. James's cats were his best friends and he was their favorite person.
24.question: What color is the cat that James found? Possible Answers :   A: Black  B: Blue  C: Yellow  D: Orange

26.context: James Catches a Fish. James loved to eat fish as a young girl. He saw fish as good food. But he asked, "Where do fish come from?" "People have to catch them," Daddy said." James wanted to know how to catch a fish. "People have caught fish from a pole, line, and hook for a long time," Daddy said." "I am about to show you how to that."  "Let's take a lunch with us," Daddy said. James chose some fries with ketchup and a bean sandwich. James also like sweets. He brought some candy bears. James has strange tastes. Daddy drove to a nearby lake. It was early. James was yawning in daddy's car. The people at the lake had special times for young people learning to fish. They talked with James about them. James was excited. Daddy took James to a small spot on the lake. Daddy showed James how to put a worm on the hook as something to get the fish. Daddy said other like things like grasshoppers, corn, or tiny fish could also get the fish. James lifted his pole and dropped his line in the water. The small red and white float was there on the water. It was easy to see that from the blue water and sunny sky. James said, "Daddy I'm bored." Daddy told his that sometimes you need to wait. After a short wait, the float went under! "James, you have a fish!" Daddy yelled. James lifted up his line and took the small fish out of the water. "Daddy, I can catch fish", He happily said.
26.question: Which of these did James like for lunch with ketchup? Possible Answers :   A: candy bears  B: bean sandwich  C: fish  D: fries

28.context: James's sister, Julia, was having a birthday party in the afternoon. James's mother was going to bake the cake for the party. Mother asked James to help her bake the cake. They chose to make a chocolate cake with chocolate frosting. James got the bowls and the ingredients they would need for the cake. She helped measure the flour, the sugar and the cocoa. Once his mother added the rest of the ingredients, James was allowed to stir the ingredients in the bowl. He helped to pour the cake mix into two pans and then put them in the oven. The smell of the cake made James hungry. While the cake was baking, James helped his mother make the chocolate frosting. His mother let him lick the spoon when they were done mixing the frosting. Once the cake was done, James and his mother took the cake out of the oven and let it cool, and then they frosted it. They ate the chocolate cake at Julia's party with scoops of vanilla ice cream and fresh strawberries. James gave their dog, Sunny, a little piece of cake too!
28.question: What did James and his mother make? Possible Answers :   A: flour and sugar  B: cake and frosting  C: ice cream and strawberries  D: Julia and Sunny

30.context: James is 30 years old, and lives in a big house. He is a doctor. James enjoys his job because he helps sick people get better. He works with another doctor, named Zeke, and with four nurses.  James had to study hard to become a doctor. He had to go to a special school for seven years. Learning to be a doctor is difficult. Only very smart and hardworking people can become doctors. James was not sad when he was studying. He enjoyed learning all about why people get sick and how to make them feel better. Now, James is a very good doctor. Sometimes other doctors ask him questions, because he knows more about some things that they do. Jim and Alice are two other doctors who became friends with James. Jim is 40 years old, and Alice is 25 years old. Sometimes they all have dinner together, and at other times they listen to music at James's house. In his free time, James likes to play basketball. James works hard, and sometimes He wants to have fun. But really, his job is fun to him. When he wakes up in the morning, he always is excited thinking about how he can help people as a doctor.
30.question: How many nurses does James work with? Possible Answers :   A: seven  B: two  C: four  D: 30

32.context: James liked his old sneakers but they were getting too small. He tried on sixteen different pairs of shoes at the mall with his mom. He was looking for green shoes with blue laces. He couldn't find any he liked and left sad. His mom wanted to cheer him up. They stopped for lunch at a restaurant drive-thru. "What do you want to order?" asked James's Mom as she got a cheeseburger and a large drink. He ordered a hamburger. While they ate, James and his mom talked about different shoes James might try on next. He didn't want to go back to the store, but he really wanted green shoes. He ate some of her fries as he thought about it. Suddenly, his mom had a great idea. They would paint a pair of new shoes green! James loved that idea. So they went to the Art Store and bought green paint. They went back to the mall and bought new blue shoelaces and white sneakers. James was so excited about his shoes that he painted them as soon as he got home. Afterwards, he walked around the house in his new shoes dripping green paint.
32.question: What color sneakers did James and his mom buy? Possible Answers :   A: Green  B: Blue  C: White  D: Yellow

174.context: I had decided that I wanted to visit my friend James whom lives quite a distance away . With this and my fear of air travel in mind I decided to take a train . After researching and finding one online I was well on my way to going to see my friend James . I drive to the station and decide that I am going to purchase a round trip ticket as this would be cheaper than just buying both tickets separately . I purchase my ticket and then go to sit down and wait for my train . Whenever my train arrives I have to get in line as they process our tickets . After all this is done I decide to take a seat by the window . I sit and fall asleep a bit as I ride on the train for hours . After a couple hours we finally reach the destination and I get off the train , excited to see my friend .
174.question: Who did they board the train with?

176.context: James helps clean the table after dinner.  He takes the plates first, scrapes the food off of them, and throws away the scraps. He sets the dishes near the sink. Then, he takes the cups two at a time, and empties them in the sink if there is any drink left in them.  He sets them next to the counter where the sink is to be washed.   Then he gathers the silverware, and any other dishes with food in them.  He wipes the table carefully, and puts back the flower decoration onto the center of the table.  He then goes back to the kitchen, to rinse the dishes, and prepare them for the dishwasher.  He loads the dishwasher with the dirty dishes, and puts the soap in the dishwasher.  He turns on the dishwasher, and goes to tell his mom that he done with the dishes and cleaning the table.
176.question: Who cleaned the table?

177.context: Olivia helps clean the table after dinner.  She takes the plates first, scrapes the food off of them, and throws away the scraps. She sets the dishes near the sink. Then, she takes the cups two at a time, and empties them in the sink if there is any drink left in them.  She sets them next to the counter where the sink is to be washed.   Then she gathers the silverware, and any other dishes with food in them.  She wipes the table carefully, and puts back the flower decoration onto the center of the table.  She then goes back to the kitchen, to rinse the dishes, and prepare them for the dishwasher.  She loads the dishwasher with the dirty dishes, and puts the soap in the dishwasher.  She turns on the dishwasher, and goes to tell her mom that she done with the dishes and cleaning the table.
177.question: Who cleaned the table?

178.context: In 1843 roguish gambler Paul Regret (Stuart Whitman) escapes a death penalty after killing in a duel James Bouvier (Gregg Palmer), the child of a Louisiana judge. Regret claimed that he would have only wounded Bouvier if he hadn't sidestepped. He is captured by Texas Ranger Jake Cutter (John Wayne) after a tryst with a mysterious lady, Pilar Graile (Ina Balin). Regret manages to escape, but is subsequently recaptured after a chance encounter with Cutter in a saloon. In the process of returning Regret to Louisiana, Cutter is forced to join forces with the condemned to fight the "Comancheros", a large criminal gang headed by a former officer that smuggles guns and whiskey to the Comanche Indians to make money and keep the frontier in a state of violence. Cutter stops at a ranch owned by a friend when there is a sudden Comanche attack. During the attack Regret jumps on a horse and flees, but instead of making a clean getaway he soon returns with a unit of Texas Rangers and the attack is repulsed. Eventually they infiltrate the self-sufficient Comanchero community at the bottom of a valley in the desert. Pilar reappears as the daughter of the wheelchair-bound but ruthless leader Graile (Nehemiah Persoff). After Cutter and the other Texas Rangers defeat both the Comanches and Comancheros, Regret and Pilar leave together for Mexico and Jake rides off into the sunset.
178.question: Whom did Paul Regret kill in a duel?

179.context: In 1843 roguish gambler Paul Regret (Stuart Whitman) escapes a death penalty after killing in a duel Olivia Bouvier (Gregg Palmer), the child of a Louisiana judge. Regret claimed that he would have only wounded Bouvier if he hadn't sidestepped. He is captured by Texas Ranger Jake Cutter (John Wayne) after a tryst with a mysterious lady, Pilar Graile (Ina Balin). Regret manages to escape, but is subsequently recaptured after a chance encounter with Cutter in a saloon. In the process of returning Regret to Louisiana, Cutter is forced to join forces with the condemned to fight the "Comancheros", a large criminal gang headed by a former officer that smuggles guns and whiskey to the Comanche Indians to make money and keep the frontier in a state of violence. Cutter stops at a ranch owned by a friend when there is a sudden Comanche attack. During the attack Regret jumps on a horse and flees, but instead of making a clean getaway he soon returns with a unit of Texas Rangers and the attack is repulsed. Eventually they infiltrate the self-sufficient Comanchero community at the bottom of a valley in the desert. Pilar reappears as the daughter of the wheelchair-bound but ruthless leader Graile (Nehemiah Persoff). After Cutter and the other Texas Rangers defeat both the Comanches and Comancheros, Regret and Pilar leave together for Mexico and Jake rides off into the sunset.
179.question: Whom did Paul Regret kill in a duel?

180.context: In pre-revolutionary Cuba, James Wormold (Alec Guinness), a vacuum cleaner salesman, is recruited by Hawthorne (NoÃ«l Coward) of the British Secret Intelligence Service to be their Havana operative. Instead of recruiting his own agents, Wormold invents agents from men he knows only by sight, and sketches "plans" for a rocket-launching pad based on vacuum parts to increase his value to the service and to procure more money for himself and his expensive daughter Milly (Jo Morrow). Because his importance grows, he is sent a secretary, James, and a radioman from London to be under his command. With their arrival it becomes much harder for Wormold to maintain his facade. However, all of his invented information begins to come true: his cables home are intercepted and believed to be true by enemy agents who then act against his "cell". One of his "agents" is killed, and he is himself targeted for assassination. He admits what he's done to his secretary, and is recalled to London. At the film's conclusion, rather than telling the truth to the prime minister and other military intelligence services, Wormold's commanders (led by Ralph Richardson) agree to fabricate a story claiming his imagined machines had been dismantled, bestow honors on Wormold, and offer him a position teaching espionage classes in London.
180.question: Who is James Wormold's secretary?

181.question: Who is James Wormold's secretary?

182.context: The film is set in Lisbon, and tells the story of a day in the life of Rita and James, a Portuguese young couple of the 90's, belonging to the first generation of Portuguese to grow up inside the European Union. The fast changing city around them makes them wish to break with all traditions and live the day the get married (only civil marriage) like it is an ordinary day. However, for some reason Rita wants to be absolutely sure James loves her and decides to cut her long black hair short before the ceremony. Rita and James still get married, but Rita's haircut would drastically and unexpectedly change their relationship.
182.question: Does the city around Rita and James make them wish to keep traditions?

184.context: James Montgomery (Ally Sheedy) is a spoiled rich boy who's hard partying life style and lack of self respect, as well as a lack of respect for others, annoys his father (Tom Skerritt) endlessly. When James gets arrested for drunk driving and drug possession, he finally pushes his father beyond his limits and, beside himself with frustration and disappointment, he says the one thing he thought he'd never say - he wishes he'd never had a son. A Fairy Godmother named Stella (Beverly D'Angelo), hears his wish and decides to comply, but she arranges it so that James never existed in his life. The next morning, she springs James from jail, but James is shocked to find that he has no money except some loose change, no family and no friends and is not sure what to do with herself, as he has never been on his own. His father, unaware about his wish coming true, has no memory of him at all. Ultimately, James is forced to take a demeaning job as a maid for an eccentric rich couple (Dick Shawn and Valerie Perrine), where he learns the true meaning of hard work, as well as the true meaning of love, friendship and self-respect. Having learned these things, he is eventually rewarded by having his old life more or less returned to him.
184.question: What does James take a job as?

185.question: What does Olivia take a job as?
